title: Add App Market listing section and share utilities

requirements.summary: Add an in-app App Market listing section with step-by-step instructions and a CTA that opens caffeine.ai in a new tab.
acceptanceCriteria: When the user views the listing section, they see step-by-step instructions written in English for listing the app in the Caffeine App Market.
A CTA button/link is present and opens https://caffeine.ai/ in a new tab (noopener noreferrer).
The listing section is reachable from the main app UI without requiring authentication.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable listing section UI that: (1) presents step-by-step English instructions for listing the app in the Caffeine App Market, (2) reuses the centralized app name/description (from REQ-9), and (3) includes a prominent CTA opening https://caffeine.ai/ in a new tab with rel="noopener noreferrer". Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card/Button/Separator) for layout and emphasis. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a composed panel that renders the new ListingSection alongside the sharing utilities UI (from REQ-8) so both are reachable from the main app UI without authentication. Use shadcn-ui components for consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the new ShareAndListPanel into the existing main app UI (no authentication required) by adding an additional tab/section alongside the existing idle-state content (e.g., in the existing Tabs area currently used for history), ensuring the listing section is discoverable from the primary UI flow. Use existing shadcn-ui Tabs components. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add sharing utilities: display current app URL, provide one-click copy with success feedback, and update footer icons to real share-intent links for the current URL.
acceptanceCriteria: A 'Copy link' control copies window.location.href and provides visible success feedback.
Footer social icons no longer use href="#" and instead open share-intent URLs in a new tab with the app URL prefilled.
All generated share URLs correctly URL-encode the app URL.
No social-media API integrations are used (only standard share-intent links).

file_operations.description: Add small, reusable helpers to build standard share-intent URLs (e.g., Facebook sharer, X intent, LinkedIn share, and/or mailto) from a provided app URL and optional text. Ensure the app URL is URL-encoded via encodeURIComponent and that helpers return fully-formed URLs suitable for opening in a new tab. (No social-media API integrations.)

Create a sharing utilities component that: (1) displays the current app URL (window.location.href), (2) provides a one-click "Copy link" action using navigator.clipboard when available (with a safe fallback), and (3) shows visible success feedback (e.g., "Copied" state/message) after copying. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card/Button) for UI consistency. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Compose the ShareUtilities component into the shared panel (alongside ListingSection). Ensure copy feedback is clearly visible in the panel and that the current URL is shown. Use shadcn-ui components for layout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Replace footer social icon placeholder href="#" links with real share-intent URLs built from the current app URL (window.location.href), opened in a new tab with rel="noopener noreferrer". Ensure all share URLs URL-encode the app URL and do not use any third-party integrationsâ€”only standard intent links. If any existing platform icon cannot support a standard web share intent, swap it for a platform that can while keeping the footer "social icons" concept intact.

requirements.summary: Centralize and consistently display the app name and short description in header/hero/footer and reuse them in the listing section.
acceptanceCriteria: The app name and a short one-sentence description are displayed consistently and reused in the listing section without duplicating conflicting copy.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create a single source of truth for app metadata used throughout the UI (e.g., exported constants for appName and appDescription in English) so header/hero/footer and the listing section can reuse consistent copy without duplication.

Update BrandHeader to import and display the centralized appName and appDescription from frontend/src/appMetadata.ts (English only), ensuring consistent branding. Keep existing generated logo usage intact (frontend/public/assets/generated/tt2yt-logo.dim_512x512.png).

Update the hero section to reuse the centralized appName and/or appDescription from frontend/src/appMetadata.ts where appropriate, keeping all user-facing text in English and consistent with the header/footer. Keep existing generated hero image usage intact (frontend/public/assets/generated/tt2yt-hero.dim_1600x900.png).

Update footer copy to use the centralized appName and appDescription (as appropriate) from frontend/src/appMetadata.ts so the app presents consistently for an App Market audience. Ensure all user-facing text remains in English and does not conflict with the header/hero copy.

Ensure the listing section reuses the centralized appName and appDescription from frontend/src/appMetadata.ts (instead of hardcoding potentially conflicting copy) while still presenting clear step-by-step listing instructions in English. Use shadcn-ui components for consistency. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
